column3: et justìțiam tuam fílio reģis~; ^ Give to the king thy judgment
column5: and to the king's son thy justice~;

column2: et páŭperes tuos in judìcio. ^ to judge thy people with justice
et colles justìțiam. ^ Let the mountains receive peace for the people

column3: et humiliábit calumniatórem. ^ He shall judge the poor of the people
column4: and he shall save the children of the poor
column5: and he shall humble the oppressor.

column3: in ģenerațióne et ģenerațiónem. ^ And he shall continue with the sun

column2: et sicut stillicádia stillántia super terram. ^ He shall come down like rain upon the fleece
column3: and as showers falling gently upon the earth.
donec aŭferátur luna. ^ In his days shall justice spring up
column5: till the moon be taken away.

column1: 9 ^ Et dominábitur a mari usqŭe ad mare
column2: et a flúmine usqŭe ad tèrminos orbis terrárum. ^ And he shall rule from sea to sea
column3: and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

column2: et inimíci ejus terram lìnģent. ^ Before him the Ethiopians shall fall down
column3: and his enemies shall lick the ground.

column1: 11 ^ Reģes Tarsis et ìnsulaĕ múnera òfferent~; reģes Arábum et Saba dona addúcent. ^ The kings of Tharsis and the islands shall offer presents~; the kings of the Arabians and of Saba shall bring gifts.
12 ^ Et adorábunt eum òmnes reģes terraĕ~; òmnes ģèntes sèrvient ei. ^ And all kings of the earth shall adore him~; all nations shall serve him.

column2: et páŭperem cui non èrat adjútor. ^ For he shall deliver the poor from the mighty
column3: and the needy that had no helper.

column2: et ánimas páŭperum salvas fáciet. ^ He shall spare the poor and needy
column3: and he shall save the souls of the poor.

column1: 15 ^ Èx usúrîs et iniqŭitáte rèdimet ánimas eórum
column2: et honorábile nomen eórum coram illo. ^ He shall redeem their souls from usuries and iniquity
column3: and their names shall be honourable in his sight.

column2: et dábitur ei de aŭro Arábiaĕ
column3: et adorábunt de ìpso sèmper~; tota die benedícent ei. ^ And he shall live
column4: and to him shall be given of the gold of Arabia
column5: for him they shall always adore~; they shall bless him all the day.

column1: 17 ^ Et èrit firmamèntum in terra in summîs mòntium~; superextollétur super Lìbanum fructus ejus
column2: et florébunt de civitáte sicut foĕnum terraĕ. ^ And there shall be a firmament on the earth on the tops of mountains~; above Lebanon shall the fruit thereof be exalted
column3: and they of the city shall flourish like the grass of the earth.

column1: 18 ^ Sit nomen ejus benedìctum in sáĕcula~; ante solem pèrmanet nomen ejus. Et benedicèntur in ìpso òmnes trìbûs terraĕ~; òmnes ģèntes magnificábunt eum. ^ Let his name be blessed for evermore~; his name continueth before the sun. And in him shall all the tribes of the earth be blessed~; all nations shall magnify him.

column3: qŭi facit mirabìlia solus. ^ Blessed be the Lord

column1: 20 ^ Et benedìctum nomen majestátis ejus in aĕtèrnum
column2: et replébitur majestáte ejus òmnis terra. Fiat
column3: fiat. ^ And blessed be the name of his majesty for ever
column4: and the whole earth shall be filled with his majesty. So be it. So be it.
